abstract: Coal, despite its deleterious effect on global warming, remains critical component of the world’s energy supply; it will probably gain share in the future, given its low price abroad; demand is expected to grow to 8.9 billion tons by 2016 from 7.9 billion tons in 2012, with bulk of new demand, about 700 million tons, coming from China.
lead_paragraph: Despite its deleterious effect on global warming, coal remains a critical component of the world’s energy supply. And given its low price abroad, it will probably gain share in the future.

headline.seo: China Leads the Way as Demand for Coal Surges Worldwide
headline.main: With China and India Ravenous for Energy, Coal’s Future Seems Assured
